comments: a(n) is the number of lattices L in Z^(n+1) such that the quotient group Z^(n+1) / L is C_9. - _Álvar Ibeas_, Nov 29 2015
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..200
A. M. Hinz, S. Klavžar, U. Milutinović, C. Petr, The Tower of Hanoi - Myths and Maths, Birkhäuser 2013. See page 100. Book's website
mathematica: Join[{a=1,b=12},Table[c=12*b-27*a;a=b;b=c,{n,60}]] (* _Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, Jan 31 2011 *)CoefficientList[Series[1/((1-3x)(1-9x)),{x,0,20}],x] (* or *) Table[ (9^(n+1) -3^(n+1))/6,{n,0,20}]  (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Apr 03 2011 *)
prog: (Sage) [lucas_number1(n,12,27) for n in xrange(1, 20)] # _Zerinvary Lajos_, Apr 27 2009(PARI) Vec(1/((1-3*x)*(1-9*x))+O(x^99)) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Sep 26 2012(PARI) a(n) = (1/6)*(9^(n+1) - 3^(n+1)); \\ _Joerg Arndt_, Feb 23 2014(MAGMA) [(1/6)*(9^(n+1)-3^(n+1)): n in [0..20]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Feb 24 2014
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
